questions.text: Apparent sadness, gloominess and despondency (irrespective of whether it is reported or not) are reflected in speech, facial expression, and posture. Rate by depth and inability to brighten up.

answers.text: No sadness
Looks dispirited but does brighten up without difficulty
Appears sad and unhappy most of the time
Looks miserable all the time. Extremely despondent

questions.text: Reported sadness: Sadness is reported as low spirits, gloominess or despondency. Rate according to intensity, duration, and the extent to which the mood is reported to be influenced by events.

answers.text: Occasional sadness in keeping with the circumstances
Sad or low but brightens up without difficulty
Pervasive feelings of sadness or gloominess. The mood is still influenced by external circumstances
Continuous or unvarying sadness, misery or despondency

questions.text: Inner tension: Feelings of ill-defined discomfort, edginess, inner turmoil, mounting distress, or a panic-like state. Rate according to intensity, frequency, duration, and the extent of reassurance called for.

answers.text: Placid. Only fleeting inner tension
Occasional feelings of edginess and ill-defined discomfort
Continuous feelings of inner tension or intermittent panic which the patient can only master with some difficulty
Unrelenting dread or anguish. Overwhelming panic

questions.text: Reduced sleep: This refers to the experience of reduced length or depth of sleep compared to the patient's own usual pattern when well.

answers.text: Sleeps as usual
Slight difficulty in falling asleep or slightly reduced, light or restless sleep
Sleep reduced or broken by at least two hours
Less than two to three hours sleep in total

questions.text: Reduced appetite: This refers to the experience of a loss of appetite compared to the patient's own usual pattern when well.

answers.text: Normal or increased appetite
Slightly reduced appetite
No appetite, food is tasteless
Needs persuasion to eat anything at all

questions.text: Concentration difficulties: Difficulties in collecting one's thoughts, poor memory, and inability to focus. This should be rated on how much it's impacting daily life.

answers.text: No difficulty in concentrating
Slight difficulties in concentrating and remembering, possibly affecting reading
Difficulties in concentrating and remembering; reads with difficulty and loses track
Unable to read or concentrate at all

questions.text: Lassitude: A difficulty getting started or slowness initiating and performing everyday activities.

answers.text: Hardly any difficulties in getting started. No sluggishness
Difficulties in starting activities
Difficulties in starting simple routine activities, which are carried out with effort
Complete lassitude. Unable to do anything without help

questions.text: Inability to feel: The subjective experience of reduced interest in the surroundings, or in other people, or in hobbies. The reduced ability to react with appropriate emotion to pleasant circumstances.

answers.text: Normal interest in surroundings and in other people
Reduced ability to enjoy usual interests. Patient can still feel pleasure or sadness but less intensely than normal
Loss of interest in surroundings and in other people. Feelings of emotional numbness. Patient may feel a sense of apathy
Complete inability to feel any emotion, even for close relatives or friends. A painful or blank feeling of emotional numbness

questions.text: Pessimistic thoughts: Feelings of guilt, inferiority, or self-blame that are out of proportion to the circumstances. The patient may feel a sense of worthlessness or a loss of self-esteem.

answers.text: No pessimistic thoughts
Fluctuating ideas of failure, self-reproach, or self-depreciation which can be overcome with a little effort
Pervasive self-reproaches, or definite but still rational ideas of guilt or sinfulness
Delusions of guilt or sin. Exaggerated and fixed ideas of worthlessness, self-blame, or responsibility for a disaster

questions.text: Suicidal thoughts: The feeling that life is not worth living, or that it would be better to be dead. Suicidal attempts should not in themselves influence the rating.

answers.text: Enjoys life or takes it as it comes
Weary of life. Only fleeting suicidal thoughts
Probably better off dead. Suicidal thoughts are common, and suicide is considered as a possible solution, but without specific plans or intention
Explicit plans for suicide when there is an opportunity. Active preparations for suicide
